alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 9:56AM MDT until April 20 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Aberdeen SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Dakota... Turtle Creek At Redfield affecting Spink County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Turtle Creek At Redfield. * WHEN...From this morning to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Moderate flooding of agricultural land outside of Redfield begins on the right side of Turtle Creek * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM CDT Monday was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening by 700 PM CDT.
